verses.kjv: Again, David gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand.
verses.ct: Once again, David assembled all the elite soldiers of Israel — 30,000 men.

verses.kjv: And David arose, and went with all the people that were with him from Baale of Judah, to bring up from thence the ark of God, whose name is called by the name of the LORD of hosts that dwelleth between the cherubims.
verses.ct: David set out with all his people from Baale of Judah to bring back the ark of God, which bears the name of the LORD of hosts who is enthroned between the cherubim.

verses.kjv: And they set the ark of God upon a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab that was in Gibeah: and Uzzah and Ahio, the sons of Abinadab, drave the new cart.
verses.ct: They placed the ark of God on a brand-new cart and transported it from Abinadab's house on the hill. Uzzah and Ahio, Abinadab's sons, were guiding the new cart.

verses.kjv: And they brought it out of the house of Abinadab which was at Gibeah, accompanying the ark of God: and Ahio went before the ark.
verses.ct: They brought it from Abinadab's house on the hill, walking alongside the ark of God, with Ahio going ahead of the ark.

verses.kjv: And David and all the house of Israel played before the LORD on all manner of instruments made of fir wood, even on harps, and on psalteries, and on timbrels, and on cornets, and on cymbals.
verses.ct: David and the entire nation of Israel celebrated in the LORD's presence with every kind of instrument made from cypress wood — harps, lyres, tambourines, rattles, and cymbals.

verses.kjv: And when they came to Nachon’s threshingfloor, Uzzah put forth his hand to the ark of God, and took hold of it; for the oxen shook it.
verses.ct: When they arrived at Nachon's threshing floor, the oxen stumbled, and Uzzah reached out and grabbed hold of the ark of God.

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Uzzah; and God smote him there for his error; and there he died by the ark of God.
verses.ct: The LORD's anger burned against Uzzah, and God struck him down right there for his irreverent act. He died there beside the ark of God.

verses.kjv: And David was displeased, because the LORD had made a breach upon Uzzah: and he called the name of the place Perezuzzah to this day.
verses.ct: David was upset because the LORD had burst out against Uzzah, and he named that place Perezuzzah, which it is still called today.

verses.kjv: And David was afraid of the LORD that day, and said, How shall the ark of the LORD come to me?
verses.ct: David was filled with dread of the LORD that day and said, "How can I possibly bring the ark of the LORD to me?"

verses.kjv: So David would not remove the ark of the LORD unto him into the city of David: but David carried it aside into the house of Obededom the Gittite.
verses.ct: So David decided not to move the ark of the LORD into the city of David. Instead, he diverted it to the house of Obededom the Gittite.

verses.kjv: And the ark of the LORD continued in the house of Obededom the Gittite three months: and the LORD blessed Obededom, and all his household.
verses.ct: The ark of the LORD remained at Obededom the Gittite's house for 3 months, and the LORD blessed Obededom and his entire household.

verses.kjv: And it was told king David, saying, The LORD hath blessed the house of Obededom, and all that pertaineth unto him, because of the ark of God. So David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obededom into the city of David with gladness.
verses.ct: When King David received word that the LORD had blessed Obededom's household and everything he owned because of the ark of God, David went and brought the ark of God up from Obededom's house to the city of David with great celebration.

verses.kjv: And it was so, that when they that bare the ark of the LORD had gone six paces, he sacrificed oxen and fatlings.
verses.ct: After the men carrying the ark of the LORD had taken 6 steps, David sacrificed an ox and a fattened calf.

verses.kjv: And David danced before the LORD with all his might; and David was girded with a linen ephod.
verses.ct: David danced in the LORD's presence with all his energy, wearing a linen ephod.

verses.kjv: So David and all the house of Israel brought up the ark of the LORD with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet.
verses.ct: So David and all the people of Israel brought the ark of the LORD up with loud shouts and the blast of trumpets.

verses.kjv: And as the ark of the LORD came into the city of David, Michal Saul’s daughter looked through a window, and saw king David leaping and dancing before the LORD; and she despised him in her heart.
verses.ct: As the ark of the LORD entered the city of David, Michal, Saul's daughter, watched from a window and saw King David leaping and dancing in the LORD's presence. She felt nothing but contempt for him.

verses.kjv: And they brought in the ark of the LORD, and set it in his place, in the midst of the tabernacle that David had pitched for it: and David offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the LORD.
verses.ct: They brought the ark of the LORD in and placed it in its spot inside the tent that David had set up for it. Then David presented burnt offerings and peace offerings in the LORD's presence.

verses.kjv: And as soon as David had made an end of offering burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: When David had finished presenting the burnt offerings and peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD of hosts.

verses.kjv: And he dealt among all the people, even among the whole multitude of Israel, as well to the women as men, to every one a cake of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine. So all the people departed every one to his house.
verses.ct: He distributed food to the entire crowd of Israel, both women and men — each person received a loaf of bread, a portion of meat, and a cake of raisins. Then everyone went home.

verses.kjv: Then David returned to bless his household. And Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, How glorious was the king of Israel to day, who uncovered himself to day in the eyes of the handmaids of his servants, as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovereth himself!
verses.ct: When David returned home to bless his family, Michal, Saul's daughter, came out to meet him and said, "What a distinguished display the king of Israel put on today — stripping down in front of his servants' slave girls like some shameless fool exposing himself!"

verses.kjv: And David said unto Michal, It was before the LORD, which chose me before thy father, and before all his house, to appoint me ruler over the people of the LORD, over Israel: therefore will I play before the LORD.
verses.ct: David replied to Michal, "I was dancing in the presence of the LORD, who chose me over your father and his entire family and appointed me as ruler over the LORD's people, over Israel. I will celebrate in the LORD's presence!

verses.kjv: And I will yet be more vile than thus, and will be base in mine own sight: and of the maidservants which thou hast spoken of, of them shall I be had in honour.
verses.ct: I will humble myself even more than this and become lowly in my own eyes. But those servant girls you mentioned — they will hold me in honor."

verses.kjv: Therefore Michal the daughter of Saul had no child unto the day of her death.
verses.ct: Michal, Saul's daughter, never had any children for the rest of her life.
